SUBJECT: So there's an amazing
book called Drugs and Travel

16.54.text:
in 20th Century Literature,
which makes the case that drugs

21.44.text:
and travel are so discursively
entangled, so discursively

27.06.text:
intimate, that we use
the same metaphors

30.09.text:
and analogies to describe the
subjective experiences of each.

34.21.text:
I mean even the
term hallucination

39.80.text:
which means to
wander in our minds.

43.41.text:
So when we are hallucinating,
we are travelling in our heads.

51.57.text:
This map that describes a
departure from the ordinary,

55.40.text:
leaving normal thoughts
behind, treading forth

59.90.text:
in the new environment
dealing with conflicts,

62.61.text:
real ones or cognitive
ones, slaying the dragon,

66.19.text:
solving the conundrum
in the existential itch,

69.03.text:
and then making the return
with a new lesson learned.

73.69.text:
Wandering in our minds and
taking the physical journey

77.03.text:
both incorporate this motif of
transformation, an unfolding

86.36.text:
We cross over, I mean, implicit
in the term ecstatic drug

91.66.text:
experience is this notion of
ecstasy, the non-static, right.

95.58.text:
The pushing through,
the crossing over,

98.07.text:
the breaking the threshold,
the piercing the veil.

104.25.text:
The curtain parts and
what has never been seen

111.97.text:
We take a trip, we
call it tripping.

116.48.text:
You see the analogies,
you see the parallels

118.76.text:
these two discursively intimate
universes revealed to us

122.41.text:
that the outer journey
and the inner journey

125.90.text:
In fact, there are
one in the same.

132.38.text:
I love that because I
have the travelers itch,

136.39.text: I yearn for the holy other.

138.43.text:
I look at the departure
monitors in the airport listing

143.94.text:
As Alain De Botton sites in
his book The Art of Travel,

146.59.text:
we look upon those
screens and we

148.34.text:
think to ourselves London,
Amsterdam, Prague, Berlin,

154.39.text:
it may be, it's anywhere
else but here, right.

157.73.text:
We long to crossover,
we long to experience,

160.59.text:
to take the trip,
to take the journey.
